intro: Jamesbrittenia maritima, commonly known as the coastal Jamesbrittenia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to thrive in saline and arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky coastal areas. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to anchor itself in loose, nutrient-poor soils. It plays a role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for coastal wildlife.
